text:
Lets start with the simple fact, that global warming (it has been renamed to "climate change" because there was no warming) does no occur and that a change in 0,00078% of the atmospheric CO2 (which is our contribution) will change nothing in temperature. Actually, CO2 doesn't drive temperature to beging with. It's the other way around. Higher Ocean temperature leads to less CO2 dissolved in water and vice versa. The only relevant source of CO2 is the Oceans. Not Volcanoes, burning forests or people in their SUVs. Mankind produces such a tiny amount of CO2 per year, that the plants on earth are absorbing it in a week. Don't forget, our food depends on CO2. Without it, we would die. So be happy we're seeing incrfeasing CO2 levels. 800-1000ppm would be great. 
I can tell you a secret that not even the IPCC knows: Our weather is 99.999% driven by the sun and 0.001% by water vapor.

Or the idea that all this 'renewable' energy such as windmills and batteries are magic and don't require old dirty means of manufacturing to make those products. Yeah sure guys, the batteries you need grow on battery trees and don't come from mines and old school means of creation. Has the earth as a whole 'warmed' to the tune of 1-1.25 degrees Celsius over the last 100 years. Pretty clear by science it has, as it also had for the over 8 100 year cycles before that (also not heavily science debated). The issue is the impact of man on this change, and I think its an honest debate despite social media saying otherwise. CO2 increases, as in the chart shown here, usually have followed an inverse in global temps (not shown here). I think that is at least important to note. Am I a 'climate denial freak?' No. Looking at the science the earth is warming. Am I a 'climate alarmist?' Also no. I can't find evidence in the data that is currently touted about how we are doomed without immediate action. Despite what videos I watch that neatly tell me to panic in a nice under 8 minute montage.

text:
If we want to effectively tackle these problems, what we need is to focus only on measures that have a real impact

1) distance tax: a tax that increases the longer the goods are shipped or transported- this incentivizes a local economy and stops the mess of goods running around the world for no reason.

2) female education- the more educated the less children they will have, as overpopulation is a huge problem

3) tackle income inequality- tax the super wealthy and the multinationals, make them pay the right share, no more tax avoidance or producing in countries with lower regulations. Big companies need the most resources and make up the biggest polluters, so local and smaller is better.

4) universal basic income so people dont have "to make a living" at any cost and follow their passions- no damaging, stupid or unnecessary work

5) make hemp biodiesel (and other biodiesels) make up 30% of all fuel compulsory in the economy and make investments. Tackle food waste and make it maximal 5% of all produced. Go towards 0% fossil fuels with improved technology. Swap most plastics for hemp-derived materials

6) sustainability index- make an index of the worst environmental offender-practices. Ban those that are not needed and bring within limits those that can be made sustainable. Use taxes to incentivize/disincentivize

7) go towards a bio-adapted infrastructure such as passages for the wild under highways and so forth. Go back to natural farming, drop all intensive farming, is healthier anyway. Decrease production of animal products. Abandon chemicals, fertilizers and pesticides, all not sustainable. 

8) we need a working UN back in some form, to protect areas such as the amazonas and other strategically important parts of the world for the ecology. Besides that we need first nation countries to invest in countries that are lagging behind, as the investment would yield much greater results. This is a global challenge.

9) drop all the measures that wont make any difference and accept that we cant control it 100% at this point. Maybe there are some benefits in a warmer climate too.

Feel free to copy/paste

text:
@Milind Correa  I'm simply 'arguing' your post, which states that you used to have 'winters' in Mumbai and now you don't. I have not physically been there, but the Indian govt. does keep records on temperatures which I can easily look up from anywhere in the world today! It shows that over 200 years it has gotten warmer there by around 2 degree Celsius in Mumbai itself. It further shows it has gotten .3 degrees Celsius in Delhi since 1930 (no data for that time frame in Mumbai specific). So 1. an average 2 degree Celsius over 2 centuries with data showing most occurring well over 100 years ago doesn't fit a post saying winters have gone away. 2. Most 1st and 2nd world countries have reduced carbon emissions in the last 40 years, making still up and coming nations like China and India the ones who are greatly increasing emissions. No blame there, as cheaper energy to lift up a population is a major reason the others exist today. 

To cut it short, all I am saying is that the observation of temperature in Mumbai over the course of your lifetime in no way supports your post stating that winters 'went away' in Mumbai. It appears by data you don't or have never really had a 'winter' there anyway. All I know of Mumbai is sadly the negative... a lot of scammers. This does seem to be a far too common reality there, but anyone I have met from 'that region at least' has been amazing. If you are there I wish you well. I just take issue with your post.
author: Kemp Kennedy

text: @Kemp Kennedy  Thank you for a detailed enlightenment. However let me put it this way, as kids we wore sweaters to school for it used to be cold enough to say winter was there. Now when I visit Mumbai around that time, I feel I’m in a desert climate, too hot, even early mornings in winter. Indian winters vary a lot by the state you live in & Mumbai used to have mild winters. text:
What is the cause of climate change and how can it be solved?
Many people think that the cause of climate change is carbon dioxide, and reducing carbon dioxide can prevent climate change.
This is a bit convincing, but not correct.
The exact cause of climate change is "thermal excess" on the earth.
Therefore, to stop climate change, we must focus on stopping of the "thermal excess".

"GREEN NEW DEAL" has good intentions. However, there are several problems. 
The biggest problem is that it is less economical. It means that it is difficult for many people to actively participate. 
Therefore, coercion must be mobilized to achieve the desired goal, and excessive coercion hinders the achievement of the goal. 
This is a fundamental problem.
Also, waste is another problem. 
Waste solar cells and waste blades are discharged, and the waste batteries of ESS adversely affect the environment.

Although there is a problem with the need for large land, the best way to reduce heat and carbon dioxide is to create big forests.
Trump should publicize the effects of "One trillion trees" to others and urge the world to join in and work together.

Why is "One trillion trees" so effective?
First of all, it is economical. Compared to solar power generation and wind power generation, it does not require a lot of funds at the beginning. 
forests has a long lifespan, and does not require additional facilities such as ESS and power transmission and distribution facilities, and does not emit waste.

In addition, One trillion trees absorb enormous amounts of solar heat.
Photosynthesis requires infrared rays from the sun.
It absorbs infrared rays (heat rays) and ultraviolet rays to perform photosynthesis, turning carbon dioxide into oxygen and making glucose.
One trillion trees absorbing solar heat is very good at slowing down climate change. 
The reason people don't really care about trees absorbing heat is that they don't think the cause of global warming is fundamentally "overheating," but rather carbon dioxide.

How can you get a lot of land? We have to use the desert.
But how to supply a huge amount of water?

text: It's grossly premature and optimistic to say that warming of 2 °C is ok.  Warming of 1 degree has already had significant effects, and a 2-deg rise will inflict extensive damage on our ability to grow food, fish the oceans, etc.  Moreover, climate change isn't just _temperature change_.  Changes to the flows of water are likely even more important.  That is, dry areas are getting dryer, and wet areas are getting wetter.  Hence, we see flooding getting worse in the American southeast, and drought getting worse in the southwest.  We now need a combination of climate change mitigation and adaptation to the amount of change that is now inevitable.

text:
John Tech but again, you’re not providing any context. 

Full quote and some context:

”'Wood concluded his profile of Strong with Strong narrating the novel he would love to compose if only he could write. 'Each year, [Strong] explains as background to the telling of the novel's plot, the World Economic Forum convenes in Davos, Switzerland. Over 1,000 CEO's, prime ministers, finance ministers, and leading academics gather in February to attend meetings and set economic agendas for the year ahead. With this as a setting, he then says: 'What if a small group of these world leaders were to conclude that the principle risk to of the rich countries? And if the world is to survive, the rich countries would have to sign an agreement reducing their impact on the environment. Will they do it? And Strong, driving as I take notes, looks at me. Then his eyes go back to Highway 17. The man who founded the United Nations Environment Program and who wrote parts of the Brundtland Report and who in 1992 will try to get the world's leaders to sign just such an agreement, savors the question hanging in the air. Will they do it? Will the rich countries agree to reduce their impact on the environment? Will they agree to save the earth? 'Strong resumes his story. 'The group's conclusion is 'no. ' The rich countries won't do it. They won't change. So, in order to save the planet, the group decides: Isn't the only hope for the planet that the industrialized civilizations collapse? Isn't it our responsibility to bring this about? '”

قال الله تعالى(لِّكَيْلَا تَأْسَوْا عَلَىٰ مَا فَاتَكُمْ وَلَا تَفْرَحُوا بِمَا آتَاكُمْ ۗ وَاللَّهُ لَا يُحِبُّ كُلَّ مُخْتَالٍ فَخُورٍ )   كَيْ  كَيْ كَيْ      قال الله تعالى(وَلِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍ رَّسُولٌ ۖ فَإِذَا جَاءَ رَسُولُهُمْ قُضِيَ بَيْنَهُم بِالْقِسْطِ وَهُمْ لَا يُظْلَمُونَ ). جَاءَ قُضِيَ لَمْ يُظْلَمُونَ . إنتهى قال رسول الله صلى الله عليه وسلم: «يوشك الأمم أن تداعى عليكم كما تداعى الأكلة إلى قصعتها»، فقال قائل: ومِن قلة نحن يومئذ؟ قال: «بل أنتم يومئذٍ كثير، ولكنكم غثاء كغثاء السيل، ولينزعن الله من صدور عدوكم المهابة منكم، وليقذفن في قلوبكم الوهن»، فقال قائل: يا رسول الله وما الوهن ؟ قال: «حب الدنيا، وكراهية الموت».   قال الله تعالى(لَقَدْ جَاءَكُمْ رَسُولٌ مِنْ أَنْفُسِكُمْ عَزِيزٌ عَلَيْهِ مَا عَنِتُّمْ حَرِيصٌ عَلَيْكُمْ بِالْمُؤْمِنِينَ رَءُوفٌ رَحِيمٌ )     جَاءَ   جَاءَ   جَاءَ   الآن ان تكرم قال الله تعالى(إِنَّا فَتَحْنَا لَكَ فَتْحًا مُبِينًا	(1) لِيَغْفِرَ لَكَ اللَّهُ مَا تَقَدَّمَ مِنْ ذَنْبِكَ وَمَا تَأَخَّرَ وَيُتِمَّ نِعْمَتَهُ عَلَيْكَ وَيَهْدِيَكَ صِرَاطًا مُسْتَقِيمًا	(2) وَيَنْصُرَكَ اللَّهُ نَصْرًا عَزِيزًا)  وين فتحت يا الله قال الله تعالى(وَقُلْ جَاءَ الْحَقُّ وَزَهَقَ الْبَاطِلُ ۚ إِنَّ الْبَاطِلَ كَانَ زَهُوقًا )قال الله تعالى(وَقُلِ اعْمَلُوا فَسَيَرَى اللَّهُ عَمَلَكُمْ وَرَسُولُهُ وَالْمُؤْمِنُونَ ۖ وَسَتُرَدُّونَ إِلَىٰ عَالِمِ الْغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ فَيُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ )
قال الله تعالى(الر ۚ تِلْكَ آيَاتُ الْكِتَابِ وَقُرْآنٍ مُّبِينٍ)قال الله تعالى(لِّكَيْلَا تَأْسَوْا عَلَىٰ مَا فَاتَكُمْ وَلَا تَفْرَحُوا بِمَا آتَاكُمْ ۗ .)لِّكَيْ لِّكَيْ قال الله تعالى(فَسِيحُوا فِي الْأَرْضِ أَرْبَعَةَ أَشْهُرٍ وَاعْلَمُوا أَنَّكُمْ غَيْرُ مُعْجِزِي اللَّهِ ۙ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ مُخْزِي الْكَافِرِينَ (2)   غَيْرُ    غَيْرُ    غَيْرُ   قال الله تعالى(الر ۚ تِلْكَ آيَاتُ الْكِتَابِ وَقُرْآنٍ مُّبِينٍ)قال الله تعالى(قُلْ مَن كَانَ عَدُوًّا لِّجِبْرِيلَ فَإِنَّهُ نَزَّلَهُ عَلَىٰ قَلْبِكَ بِإِذْنِ اللَّهِ مُصَدِّقًا لِّمَا بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ وَهُدًى وَبُشْرَىٰ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ )قال الله تعالى (وَإِذَا كُنتَ فِيهِمْ فَأَقَمْتَ لَهُمُ الصَّلَاةَ فَلْتَقُمْ طَائِفَةٌ مِّنْهُم مَّعَكَ وَلْيَأْخُذُوا أَسْلِحَتَهُمْ فَإِذَا سَجَدُوا فَلْيَكُونُوا مِن وَرَائِكُمْ وَلْتَأْتِ طَائِفَةٌ أُخْرَىٰ لَمْ يُصَلُّوا فَلْيُصَلُّوا مَعَكَ وَلْيَأْخُذُوا حِذْرَهُمْ وَأَسْلِحَتَهُمْ ۗ وَدَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَوْ تَغْفُلُونَ عَنْ أَسْلِحَتِكُمْ وَأَمْتِعَتِكُمْ فَيَمِيلُونَ عَلَيْكُم مَّيْلَةً وَاحِدَةً ۚ وَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَيْكُمْ إِن كَانَ بِكُمْ أَذًى مِّن مَّطَرٍ أَوْ كُنتُم مَّرْضَىٰ أَن تَضَعُوا أَسْلِحَتَكُمْ ۖ وَخُذُوا حِذْرَكُمْ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ أَعَدَّ لِلْكَافِرِينَ عَذَابًا مُّهِينًا)                       أَسْلِحَتَهُمْ  <------>   أَسْلِحَتِكُمْ  بُشْرَىٰ لُيَّ    بُشْرَىٰ لُيَّ   قال الله تعالي(وَقُلِ اعْمَلُوا فَسَيَرَى اللَّهُ عَمَلَكُمْ وَرَسُولُهُ وَالْمُؤْمِنُونَ ۖ وَسَتُرَدُّونَ إِلَىٰ عَالِمِ الْغَيْبِ وَالشَّهَادَةِ فَيُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ)  قال الله تعالى (وَقُلْ جَاءَ الْحَقُّ وَزَهَقَ الْبَاطِلُ ۚ text:
TOP 10 FACTS CLIMATE CHANGE FANATICS DON'T WANT YOU TO KNOW

1. The current global warming started about 12,000 years ago. That's how the last ice age ended and the current geological period, the Holocene, began. This warm and cozy climate won't last forever. Interglacial periods last between 20,000 and 60,000 years.

2. The rate at which the sea level is rising now is much lower compared to how it rose between 12,000 and 7,000 years ago – a period in which the sea level rose by 197 ft (60 m). Look up the Early Holocene Sea Level Rise if you want to learn more.

3. The climate is always changing. There is no such thing as a stable climate. If you want to learn more about the "stability" of the climate, you might want to look up:
– The 8.2 Kiloyear Event
– The Little Ice Age
– The Year Without a Summer (1816)

4. Chaos Theory tells us why the behavior of some systems is unpredictable (chaotic). Even simple systems can exhibit chaotic behavior, like the double pendulum. No one can predict the climate, because the climate is a stupidly complex chaotic system.

5. Compared to water, CO₂ plays an insignificant role in the global greenhouse effect. Because – and I'm not making this up – 95% of all greenhouse gases is water vapor. 

6.  During the Hirnantian glaciation the atmospheric CO₂ levels were 10–16 times higher than today. 

7. CO₂ is not a pollutant. CO₂ is plant food. Almost all the oxygen in the atmosphere is a byproduct of photosynthesis – a process by which plants use light energy to produce glucose from CO₂ and water. Without CO₂ plants die. Without plants, we die. CO₂ is used in the food industry, for example, in the production of carbonated beverages like: beer, soda, sparkling water etc. CO₂ is also used in hospitals, for example, in laparoscopic surgery. There are real pollutants out there we should be worried about and CO₂ is not one of them.

8. Compared to astronomical factors like solar activity or the Milankovitch Cycles or terrestrial factors like volcanic activity, human activity has an insignificant effect in the long term evolution of the climate. We cannot start, end, or prevent ice ages or global warmings. We're not a type I civilization.

9. This may came as a shock to you, but we're actually in the middle of a 2.58-million-year-old glaciation – the Quaternary Glaciation – look it up!

10.  There are many scientists who disagree with various aspects of anthropogenic climate change. One of them is Ivar Giaever, Nobel laureate in physics, who said that "Global Warming is pseudoscience". Freeman Dyson said that "Climate Change predictions are absurd". Wikipedia has a List of scientists who disagree with the scientific consensus on global warming, but it only contains the names of those scientists "who have their own Wikipedia article." Keep in mind that science doesn't work by consensus. Science isn't a democracy. As Carl Sagan put it:

“Science is more than a body of knowledge. It is a way of thinking; a way of skeptically interrogating the universe with a fine understanding of human fallibility. If we are not able to ask skeptical questions, to interrogate those who tell us that something is true, to be skeptical of those in authority, then, we are up for grabs for the next charlatan (political or religious) who comes rambling along.”

In general, when you're convinced of your truth, make an effort to get out of the echo chamber and listen to a skeptic scientist who doesn't share your beliefs on the subject.

text:
Here is the solution, especially if you're living in a rich country: Consume less!

I reduced my personal carbon footprint by 70% by changing my lifestyle. Can you do the same? 
1. For 3 years I've been a vegetarian.
2. In 2019, I didn't travel by airplane. I won't in 2020 either. It's an addiction, even I LOVE to travel by plane.
3. I ditched my gasoline car for an electric car that I travel with instead of the Airplane-trips. A trip from Norway to the south of Spain for a family of 4 is 14000 times more polluted if you travel by airplane than if you're going with your electric car. The best thing to do is to not go at all. 
4. In 2019 I didn't buy any clothes. In 2020 I bought the clothes I need for all of this year. 
5. I moved my family from a big house to an apartment 1/3 the size.  
6. Voting for the politicians who are the most environmentally friendly. 

I'm always amazed to speak to my friends who travel frequently around the world, they eat meat multiple times per week, never thinking of their impact. 
It is as if the global warming issue is only up to politicians to fix, but the politicians are more concerned about their own survival in the political game. Why is it so cheap to do the most pollutive actions, such as flying? Money speaks, unfortunately. 
Also, most climate influencers are hypocritical with their HUGE personal footprints. 

As David Attenborough said: "We can't go on saying 'but there's hope' and leave it to next year"

Disclaimer: All of the above may seem like bragging. Normally, I would not speak out loud about things like this. I wrote it still, as we need to hurry up. I'd love to travel more by plane, eat meat, buy whatever I want etc. like I used to. Can't justify it. Not anymore.

text:
Climate change is the current pretext to justify halting use of the land resource. Building upwards and ceasing expansion outwards causes home prices to skyrocket and places the lifetime earnings of citizens extracted through rent squarely into the hands of the International Socialists. Within a generation a nation is turned into a vassal. 

A similar campaign half a century ago employing agricultural land as the pretext caused home prices to launch from the ten thousand dollar to the million dollar level pricing homes beyond reach while simultaneously making million dollar an acre land unfeasible to farm.

Organized protest, including pleas from children, attends each attempted use of land.

Each time another tract of land is “protected” the public cheers. Those most affected tighten the snare on their own demise. Thousands of homeless in each city. 

All of the land on this planet was promised to the chosen few, together with the increase that it yields. It is being redeemed.


Footnotes:

Preserving farmland inspired a movement to protect all land from development instead of making forestland that we have in extravagant abundance available for housing. This restriction caused farmland values to skyrocket making it uneconomical to till. Homes that were $10,000 to $60,000 with the average price ranging from $10,000 in most cities to $24,000 in the more expensive regions rose to multi-millions as a result of the artificially created shortage. A mile width of forestland over a short distance near cities would eliminate the housing issue permanently. Saving a forest is ill-conceived. Nature ignores man’s declarations and continues on its usual course of cleansing by fire the forest of its dead, dying and diseased to make way for new growth, as it has been doing since time immemorial. 

A generation prevented from acquiring a home and becoming established lives for experience that soon devolves to escape by taking drugs.

Citizens whose income enabled them to purchase a ten thousand dollar home with a value that now exceeds a million dollars are doomed. Their home must be sold to cover deferred property taxes and to repay loans secured by equity upon winding-up of their estate. The freedom that derives from owning your own home is ending.

Civic governments reap a bonanza from property assessments generating billion dollar surpluses. This is “invested” in the equivalent of municipals that return $3 in forty years time for each $100 spent on acquiring them now. Young people work two shifts daily in order to keep a roof over their heads, one that they will never own. A third of the world away a hill of sand is transformed into a metropolis. 

Citizens have been conditioned to view with anathema and as evil National Socialism in which the resources of a nation and economic output of its population benefits their own country.

An enduring legacy of Communism as well as its ulterior motive is the departure of residents from family dwellings into highrises enabling International Socialists to capture their lifetime earnings through rent and for all time to subjugate these nations. Democratic nations enact regulations that are a bottomless pit in order to frustrate and end the construction and private ownership of homes.

Economic distortion arising from this deliberately created artificial shortage with all earnings going towards rent that enriches the chosen few acts like a cancerous tumor destroying its host.

text: Heat can travel in 3 ways, conduction, convection, and radiation. Radiation is when heat travels as infrared "light" or an electromagnetic sine wave/quantum particle with a relatively low frequency. Heat can only escape from the earth out to the vacuum of space by radiation, because it's a vacuum largely devoid of matter, and matter is required for the other to types. Greenhouse gases block infrared radiation. Entropy on the earth turns higher frequency waves into heat/infrared, like a park bench getting hot in the sun

text:
This could have been done a lot better. They wrongly focus on urging individual consumers to make lifestyle changes. While that does matter to a degree, the real problem is that the corporate and political elite are deliberately choosing to downplay the importance of climate change in the media, and many have worked very hard on campaigns to spread doubt about the science and make it seem like a hoax so that they aren't held responsible for their oversized role in pollution.
As long as the single most-watched TV news network in the USA (Fox) continues to outright deny climate change, tiny outlets like this one aren't gonna make a big difference. Fox is the chief information source for tens of millions. Whatever they say is what half of the USA will believe.
Also, putting the onus on consumers rather than governments and corporations is an intentional strategy to deflect attention away from the real culprits. They want you to worry about taking quicker showers (or something trivial like that) while they continue putting off upgrading their behemoth-polluter coal plants and other sources of actually significant greenhouse gases.

text: Greenhouse gases like Carbon dioxide, Methane, and Water vapour can't heat the planet or trap heat for any length of time. A tropical jungle at the equator might feel hotter but the temperature has been buffered compared to the heat in a desert. We do not live in a contained system it is an open system which allows heat to escape. Heat rises by convection and it is only slowed temporally as it passes through denser materials like water vapour. Carbon dioxide and methane are trace gases measured in part per million / parts per billion respectively in the atmosphere, they simply can not radiate heat energy back to heat the planet. The human body emits infrared energy/ heat so imagine trying to heat the floor in your lounge while suspended 2 metres off the ground and there is no roof.  Any small heat escapes and head upwards. The main heat source is the Sun and atmospheric pressure helps to maintain heat levels. it is the reason why it is colder at the top of the mountain and warmer at the surface and why the core is a molten ball.

text:
You know where the 97% figure came from?

77 ÷79 = 97%.Your credibility is ad good as that figure.

"I would point out to the readers that the second biased culling of the group (the first being sending questionnaires only to academics and government scientists) occurred when over two thirds of those to whom the questionnaire was sent (6854 of 10,000) didn’t respond. Thus we have no idea what they believed. Therefore, at the most, the consensus of scientists questioned could only be 31.5%, and that’s only if all 3146 respondents agreed.


In the end, Doran used the exceedingly skewed numbers of 77 of 79 to obtain the 97% figure when he should have used 77 of 10,000 to obtain only 0.8% consensus!


In other words, of 10,000 scientists to whom the questionnaire was sent, only 77 responded with agreement. Without knowledge of the 6854 non-responders, at most the study reveals only a 0.8% consensus. This would have been the honest conclusion.


The multiple episodes of this type of deceit by climate change alarmists alone should make everyone skeptical of their alarmist conclusions."

text:
Climate change is a set of contradictory beliefs and actions.

For example, we are told that there's almost no time left before it's "too late". Yet are also told that countries like China and India must be allowed to increase their CO2 emissions. Whatever reductions are to be had in the west are more than offset by increases in the developing world. 

Another example. We must transition to wind and solar, yet the environmentalists oppose the extraction of the minerals and resources needed to build all this infrastructure. They oppose the opening of mines and smelters. In some cases they even oppose the building of wind farms and have launched legal challenges that delay their construction.

We are told we must decrease CO2 emissions, then the zero emissions nuclear power plants are shut down, which increases CO2 emissions because gas and coal-fueled electrical power plants are used to make up the shortfall. 

The more you understand these contradictions, you come to see that many of these environmentalists are not genuinely green, but use environmentalism for ulterior motives. Environmentalism becomes a scare tactic of ever-egged claims and catastrophisation to push forward socialism and the transfer of jobs and wealth to the developing world. This is why the environmentalists are called watermelons: green on the outside but red and seedy on the inside.

text:
@Kemp Kennedy  Models for the effects of climate change are varied, ranging from utopian where we managed to do everything right to worst case scenarios. Even if those worse case scenarios are unlikely, even their possibility is worth taking seriously. We won’t get a best case scenario if we don’t do anything about the track we are headed down. We can’t keep arguing about whether the problem is really happening when people are already feeling the effects now. We can’t say for certain how well those models match reality because they extend into the future (a time when we can’t take measurements until it becomes the present). But just because there are more tweaks to make to the models doesn’t mean they ought to be thrown out wholesale. Their predictions are useful. Science is always evolving and there’s always room to improve, but the level of consensus on the issue of climate change is near the level of consensus on Evolution as concept. It’s not worthy of debate, especially when debate is being used to hold the conversation back from exploring actual solutions to the problem.
Also scientists don’t owe randos on the internet or fringes of their community a thorough debunking because the work they put into proving their claims and constructing and testing their models serves as enough refutation.

text:
Ya on the surface level, it seems confusing. I think it’s rather a good chance to dig a little deeper to find out what that means. Since having bits and pieces of what people say rearranged all over the place makes it hard to understand the context of what was being said. 

PBS has a video (free / on YouTube) that explains our earth history. Basically, according to paleoclimatology (digging into earth to study chemical makeup of the environment), shows that right now, in the Holocene era, we are technically in an ice age and we are in the period where glaciation should be happening - the glaciers in the North and South poles and in high elevation mountain ranges should be growing. Yet it is not.

author: SnowWhalez

text:
SnowWhalez. 

Scientists call the epoch we are living in Holocene, which is in the Quaternary Period, and it goes back to roughly 2.5 million years ago. The Quaternary Period has a pattern of glaciation and interglaciation that relates to earth’s orbital elongation, obliquity, and precession. Right now, we are over due for glaciation. A sweltering green house effect is a pattern that dominated the Mesozoic Era, an earth environment where dinosaurs roamed.
